sentences.english: He slowly climbed over the fallen rocks.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地爬過那些落下來的岩石。

sentences.english: His sunken cheeks slowly reddened and burned with miserable shame.
sentences.chinese: 他羞愧萬分，凹陷的面頰上慢慢地透出了紅色。

sentences.english: You don't have tol bust your ass all the time. 'cause life is going on.
sentences.chinese: 你不要總是那麼拼命，人生還很長，要慢慢來。

sentences.english: A. silver crescent moon set slowly below the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 一鉤銀月慢慢從地平線上落下去。

sentences.english: On one of many cold frosty nights, I shut my caravan door behind me and took a step out into the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 在一個寒冷的霜夜，我關上房車的門，慢慢步入黑暗。

sentences.english: Often rather and slowly hike to her mercilessly rumple contiguous she into bosom in.
sentences.chinese: 常寧慢慢走到她的身邊，狠狠的將她揉進懷中。

sentences.english: The fish just moved away slowly and the old man could not raise him an inch.
sentences.chinese: 那魚只顧慢慢地遊開去，老人無法把它往上拉一英寸。

sentences.english: Because, slowly but surely, you are doing your gender a disservice.
sentences.chinese: 因爲慢慢你會發現你無疑在給你的男性魅力幫倒忙。

sentences.english: Slowly pour in the flour, stir well.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢倒進麪粉，邊加邊拌勻。

sentences.english: We could do nothing but walk slowly in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 除了慢慢走，我們什麼也不能做。

sentences.english: Love is patience of awaiting slow growth of its meaning as time elapses.
sentences.chinese: 愛是耐心，是等待意義在時間中慢慢生成。

sentences.english: Then, sometimes, the door slowly opens and gapes _ for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 有時房門會慢慢打開，敞着不動。

sentences.english: You need to savour this wine to get its full flavor.
sentences.chinese: 要想充分體驗這種酒的醇美，你需要慢慢地去品嚐。

sentences.english: Slowly insidiously the fog of the everyday has returned to enshroud me.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地，不知不覺地，日常的迷霧又回來籠罩了我。

sentences.english: Water inched its way up the steps as first as first-floor outside walls collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 當一樓外牆塌陷時水慢慢地沿着臺階漫了上來。

sentences.english: The road is extending under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 路在我的腳下慢慢的延長。

definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
(of time) to elapse or pass/(of a situation) to develop or evolve
